Name: BattleMaster
About the game: role In addition to your initial selection, you can also recruit new characters in your guild, each with its own unique strengths * Soldiers have a strong endurance * Mages can do a huge amount of spell damage * The assassin is highly mobile, can do extremely high explosive damage, and can impose a variety of restrictions on the enemy * Mercenary can continue to make remote output * In addition to healing, the priest can strengthen friendly forces or weaken enemies * Non-commissioned officers have powerful skills of great weight skills In addition to the initial skills, each character can learn more powerful skills, and a variety of skills can be used in a variety of battlefield situations equipment Equipment is one of the main ways you enhance your character. Each character has several equipment fields that you can wear to gain attributes (some characters don't have off-hand equipment). You can get equipment from stores and battles (depending on your current combat level) You can also enhance existing equipment in the lab Props You can retrieve items from the store and use them in battle to gain an advantage Props are expendable and will disappear after use After purchasing the item, remember to assign the item to the required character in the screen fight Raise your combat level by fighting, so you can get more powerful equipment and challenge more powerful enemies There are many tricks in combat, such as attacking the enemy from behind and doing more damage Some monsters have elemental attributes, and elemental restraint can be used to deal with them more effectively, achieving twice the result with half the effort
